name.description: The name of the policy definition to get.
The policy definition version.  The format is x.y.z where x is the major version number, y is the minor version number, and z is the patch number
The name of the policy set definition to get.
The policy set definition version.  The format is x.y.z where x is the major version number, y is the minor version number, and z is the patch number

properties.description: The policy set definition version properties.

The name of the policy set definition to get.

properties.description: The policy set definition version properties.

name.description: The name of the policy definition to get.

properties.description: The policy set definition version properties.

identity.description: The managed identity associated with the policy assignment.

location.description: The location of the policy assignment. Only required when utilizing managed identity.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment to get.

ExternalEvaluationEndpointSettings.description: The settings of an external endpoint providing evaluation results.

ExternalEvaluationEnforcementSettings.description: The details of the source of external evaluation results required by the policy during enforcement evaluation.

endpointSettings.description: The settings of an external endpoint providing evaluation results.

missingTokenAction.description: What to do when evaluating an enforcement policy that requires an external evaluation and the token is missing. Possible values are Audit and Deny and language expressions are supported.

resultLifespan.description: The lifespan of the endpoint invocation result after which it's no longer valid. Value is expected to follow the ISO 8601 duration format and language expressions are supported.

roleDefinitionIds.description: An array of the role definition Ids the assignment's MSI will need in order to invoke the endpoint.

Identity.description: Identity for the resource.  Policy assignments support a maximum of one identity.  That is either a system assigned identity or a single user assigned identity.

type.description: The identity type. This is the only required field when adding a system or user assigned identity to a resource.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The user identity associated with the policy. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

NonComplianceMessage.description: A message that describes why a resource is non-compliant with the policy. This is shown in 'deny' error messages and on resource's non-compliant compliance results.

message.description: A message that describes why a resource is non-compliant with the policy. This is shown in 'deny' error messages and on resource's non-compliant compliance results.

policyDefinitionReferenceId.description: The policy definition reference ID within a policy set definition the message is intended for. This is only applicable if the policy assignment assigns a policy set definition. If this is not provided the message applies to all policies assigned by this policy assignment.

selectors.description: The list of the selector expressions.

value.description: The value to override the policy property.

ParameterDefinitionsValue.description: The definition of a parameter that can be provided to the policy.

allowedValues.description: The allowed values for the parameter.

defaultValue.description: The default value for the parameter if no value is provided.

schema.description: Provides validation of parameter inputs during assignment using a self-defined JSON schema. This property is only supported for object-type parameters and follows the Json.NET Schema 2019-09 implementation. You can learn more about using schemas at https://json-schema.org/ and test draft schemas at https://www.jsonschemavalidator.net/.

type.description: The data type of the parameter.

assignPermissions.description: Set to true to have Azure portal create role assignments on the resource ID or resource scope value of this parameter during policy assignment. This property is useful in case you wish to assign permissions outside the assignment scope.

displayName.description: The display name for the parameter.

strongType.description: Used when assigning the policy definition through the portal. Provides a context aware list of values for the user to choose from.

assignmentType.description: The type of policy assignment. Possible values are NotSpecified, System, SystemHidden, and Custom. Immutable.

definitionVersion.description: The version of the policy definition to use.

description.description: This message will be part of response in case of policy violation.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy assignment.

enforcementMode.description: The policy assignment enforcement mode. Possible values are Default, DoNotEnforce, and Enroll

metadata.description: The policy assignment metadata. Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

nonComplianceMessages.description: The messages that describe why a resource is non-compliant with the policy.

parameters.description: The parameter values for the assigned policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition or policy set definition being assigned.

resourceSelectors.description: The resource selector list to filter policies by resource properties.

selfServeExemptionSettings.description: The self-serve exemption settings for the policy assignment.

additionalMetadataId.description: A resource ID of a resource that contains additional metadata about the group.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy definition.

externalEvaluationEnforcementSettings.description: The details of the source of external evaluation results required by the policy during enforcement evaluation.

metadata.description: The policy definition metadata.  Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

mode.description: The policy definition mode. Some examples are All, Indexed, Microsoft.KeyVault.Data.

parameters.description: The parameter definitions for parameters used in the policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

policyType.description: The type of policy definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, Custom, and Static.

version.description: The policy definition version in #.#.# format.

versions.description: A list of available versions for this policy definition.

definitionVersion.description: The version of the policy definition to use.

groupNames.description: The name of the groups that this policy definition reference belongs to.

parameters.description: The parameter values for the referenced policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition or policy set definition.

policyDefinitionReferenceId.description: A unique id (within the policy set definition) for this policy definition reference.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy definition.

externalEvaluationEnforcementSettings.description: The details of the source of external evaluation results required by the policy during enforcement evaluation.

metadata.description: The policy definition metadata.  Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

mode.description: The policy definition mode. Some examples are All, Indexed, Microsoft.KeyVault.Data.

parameters.description: The parameter definitions for parameters used in the policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

policyType.description: The type of policy definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, Custom, and Static.

version.description: The policy definition version in #.#.# format.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy set definition.

metadata.description: The policy set definition metadata.  Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

parameters.description: The policy set definition parameters that can be used in policy definition references.

policyDefinitionGroups.description: The metadata describing groups of policy definition references within the policy set definition.

policyDefinitions.description: An array of policy definition references.

policyType.description: The type of policy set definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, Custom, and Static.

version.description: The policy set definition version in #.#.# format.

versions.description: A list of available versions for this policy set definition.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy set definition.

metadata.description: The policy set definition metadata.  Metadata is an open ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

parameters.description: The policy set definition parameters that can be used in policy definition references.

policyDefinitionGroups.description: The metadata describing groups of policy definition references within the policy set definition.

policyDefinitions.description: An array of policy definition references.

policyType.description: The type of policy definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, Custom, and Static.

version.description: The policy set definition version in #.#.# format.

ResourceSelector.description: The resource selector to filter policies by resource properties.

name.description: The name of the resource selector.

selectors.description: The list of the selector expressions.

in.description: The list of values to filter in.

notIn.description: The list of values to filter out.

SelfServeExemptionSettings.description: The self-serve exemption settings for a policy assignment.

enabled.description: Indicates whether self-serve exemption is enabled.

policyDefinitionReferenceIds.description: The policy definition reference IDs for self-serve exemption.

name.description: The policy definition version.  The format is x.y.z where x is the major version number, y is the minor version number, and z is the patch number
The policy set definition version.  The format is x.y.z where x is the major version number, y is the minor version number, and z is the patch number

properties.description: The policy set definition version properties.
